verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses, 'Go in to Pharaoh, for I have hardened his heart and the hearts of his servants, that I may show these signs of mine among them,
verses.comment: Consistent with the Hebrew verb tense for 'hardened.'

verses.text: and that you may tell in the hearing of your son and your grandson how I have dealt harshly with the Egyptians and what signs I have done among them, that you may know that I am the LORD.'
verses.comment: 'Dealt harshly' renders the Hebrew word for 'mocked' or 'made sport of.'

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh and said to him, 'Thus says the LORD, the God of the Hebrews: How long will you refuse to humble yourself before me? Let my people go, so that they may serve me.
verses.comment: Retains the call for Pharaoh to 'humble himself.'

verses.text: For if you refuse to let my people go, behold, tomorrow I will bring locusts into your territory,
verses.comment: Retains 'locusts,' referring to one of the ten plagues.

verses.text: and they will cover the face of the land, so that no one can see the ground. They will eat what is left to you after the hail, and they will eat every tree of yours that grows in the field,
verses.comment: Phrase 'face of the land' is a literal rendering from Hebrew.

verses.text: and your houses will be filled, and the houses of all your servants, and of all the Egyptians—as neither your fathers nor your fathers' fathers have seen, from the day they came on the earth to this day.' Then he turned and went out from Pharaoh.
verses.comment: 'Fathers' fathers' is literal for 'grandfathers.'

verses.text: Then Pharaoh's servants said to him, 'How long shall this man be a snare to us? Let the men go, so that they may serve the LORD their God. Do you not yet understand that Egypt is ruined?'
verses.comment: 'Snare' is literal rendering; 'men' (Hebrew: 'the men') can mean all adults or the whole people.

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron were brought back to Pharaoh, and he said to them, 'Go, serve the LORD your God. But who exactly are going?'
verses.comment: Literal translation: 'But who and who are going?'

verses.text: And Moses said, 'We will go with our young and our old, with our sons and our daughters, with our flocks and herds; for we must hold a feast to the LORD.'
verses.comment: Exact groups listed as in original Hebrew.

verses.text: But he said to them, 'The LORD be with you, if I ever let you and your little ones go! See, you have evil intent in mind.
verses.comment: The phrase is a form of oath or sarcasm.

verses.text: No! Go, the men among you, and serve the LORD, for that is what you are asking.' And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.
verses.comment: Pharaoh restricts the exodus to the men only.

verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses, 'Stretch out your hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, so that they may come up on the land of Egypt and eat every plant of the land, all that the hail has left.'
verses.comment: Referencing the previous plague: hail.

verses.text: So Moses stretched out his staff over the land of Egypt, and the LORD brought an east wind upon the land all that day and all that night. When it was morning, the east wind had brought the locusts.
verses.comment: Kept tenses faithful to original sequence.

verses.text: The locusts came up over all the land of Egypt and settled on all the territory of Egypt. Such a dense swarm of locusts as had never been before, nor ever will be again.
verses.comment: The comparison is emphasized as in Hebrew.

verses.text: For they covered the face of the whole land, so that the land was darkened. And they ate all the plants in the land and all the fruit of the trees that the hail had left. Not a green thing remained, neither tree nor plant of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
verses.comment: Phrase 'face of the whole land' is kept literal.

verses.text: Then Pharaoh hurriedly called Moses and Aaron and said, 'I have sinned against the LORD your God, and against you.
verses.comment: Pharaoh confesses similarly as in the Hebrew.

verses.text: Now please forgive my sin only this once, and plead with the LORD your God only to take away this death from me.'
verses.comment: 'This death' refers to the deadly impact of the plague.

verses.text: So he went out from Pharaoh and pleaded with the LORD.
verses.comment: Direct, literal translation from the Hebrew.

verses.text: And the LORD turned a very strong west wind, which picked up the locusts and drove them into the Red Sea. Not a single locust remained in all the territory of Egypt.
verses.comment: The 'Red Sea' is the literal rendering of 'Yam Suph.'

verses.text: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go.
verses.comment: 'Children of Israel' is a literal, traditional rendering.

verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses, 'Stretch out your hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, a darkness that may be felt.'
verses.comment: 'Darkness that may be felt' is the literal Hebrew phrasing.

verses.text: So Moses stretched out his hand toward heaven, and there was thick darkness in all the land of Egypt for three days.
verses.comment: Number 'three days' is literal.

verses.text: They did not see one another, nor did anyone rise from his place for three days; but all the children of Israel had light where they lived.
verses.comment: 'Children of Israel' and 'had light' is a faithful rendering.

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called Moses and said, 'Go, serve the LORD; your little ones also may go with you; only let your flocks and your herds stay behind.'
verses.comment: 'Little ones' and 'herds' are literal translations.

verses.text: But Moses said, 'You must also let us have sacrifices and burnt offerings, so that we may sacrifice them to the LORD our God.
verses.comment: Burnt offerings are the Hebrew 'olah.'

verses.text: Our livestock also must go with us; not a hoof shall be left behind, for we must take from them to serve the LORD our God, and we do not know with what we must serve the LORD until we arrive there.'
verses.comment: 'Not a hoof shall be left behind' is a literal translation.

verses.text: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.
verses.comment: Literal: 'hardened Pharaoh’s heart.'

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to him, 'Get away from me! Take care never to see my face again, for on the day you see my face you shall die.'
verses.comment: Literal threat of death at seeing Pharaoh’s face again.

verses.text: Moses said, 'You have spoken rightly; I will never see your face again.'
verses.comment: Phrase is a faithful rendering; see Ex. 12:31 for fulfillment.
